C o m m e n t:
Medon semiobscurus
is distributed and common in Anatolia and the Middle East, eastwards to Iran . Its distribution borders parapatrically on that of the closely related
M. brunneus
. In Greece ,
M. semiobscurus
has been recorded only from the islands Samos, Rhodos, and Lesbos, from where
M. brunneus
is unknown, and in

Turkey ,
M. brunneus
is confined to the very northwest, where
M. semiobscurus
is absent ( ASSING 2004a , 2005a , 2005b , 2006 ).
Several specimens collected in Turkey in April are teneral.
